channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023120213
item.description:
Report E-2023120213

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 oz of SSI solvent 150 (UN1268) released from a 55 gallon poly due to packaging failure. The release impacted the side of the drum. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who agreed to create an overpack with proper PPE onsite. They overpacked the drum into a 65 gallon poly and it was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023111182
item.description:
Report X-2023111182

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The corrosive HazMat was shipped to the facility in the belly of the trailer. According to the injured employee, the HazMat was leaking in transit. They went to lift the HazMat package and found the contents of the package had been spilled onto their clothes when it made contact with their abdomen. There was no sign of a spill prior to the employee lifting the package. DescribePack: The package contained two plastic containers of corrosive liquid. One of the containers were found with a missing cap/lid. The containers hold approximately 2.5 gallons of liquid. The spilled container looked to be missing around half of its contents. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Employee used a shower station to mitigate injury to their skin. The manager of the unload stopped work and had QA assess and clean the spill.

item.title: Report E-2023120193
item.description:
Report E-2023120193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of RectorSeal GENE™ 404L Low VOC PVC solvent cement (UN1133) was released from one 1-gallon metal jug due to improper loading by terminal LHW. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 10 gallon DM contains four 1-gallon metal jugs of RectorSeal GENE™ 404L Low VOC PVC solvent cement only. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120128
item.description:
Report E-2023120128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: Wilmington
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 30, 2023, two (2) one-gallon cans of paint were crushed and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and cleaners to remediate the site. All cleanup waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted freight was re-secured, shrink-wrapped, and staged for further process and shipping.

  • Description: X-2023120124, X-2023120125: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded from trailer, a trainer moved package onto rollers and noticed small bubbles coming from the cap. Trainer then notified manager who contacted trained personnel. drum was isolated and taken to hazmat area for further processing DescribePack: seal on drum cap was faulty DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was isolated and trained personnel used absorbent material in area where drum was to ensure any liquid that leaked was cleaned up prior to moving to hazmat area for further processing.

item.title: Report E-2023120085
item.description:
Report E-2023120085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 28, 2023, two (2) 12-ounce bottles of UN1873 were punctured in transit and released approximately 24 ounces of product to the concrete dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE deployed neutralizer and absorbents to the release. The crew placed the two (2) damaged bottles and all UN1873-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023120063
item.description:
Report E-2023120063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: Toledo
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor. Hepaco containerized the damaged and empty pails and applied absorbents to the trailer floor. They confirmed the cause of the release was due to a load shift. Personnel completed clean up generating two (2) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum containing the empty five (5) gallon pails, impacted absorbents, shrink wrap and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor’s demolition. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in trailer to be leaking grey liquid and having strong smell. Manager alerted trained personnel who isolated leaking package and the packages that were leaked on for further processing. DescribePack: package was crushed and wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was isolated and spill was contained by absorbent material

item.title: Report E-2023120012
item.description:
Report E-2023120012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of adhesive was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. The crew also utilized degreaser and absorbent wipes to further remediate the release. All adhesive-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by the facility.

item.title: Report E-2023120011
item.description:
Report E-2023120011

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2693 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty-five (55) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized a pressure washer to the empty sodium bisulfite-impacted trailer and collected the impacted water with absorbents and absorbent pads. Crews collected and containerized the absorbents and absorbent pads into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted pallets and cardboard were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and the damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon over-pack, all for terminal disposal.

  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbent pads to clean the initial release. The crew containerized the damaged 5-gallon pail in one (1) drum liner, and all impacted absorbent pads were placed in one (1) additional drum liner. Both drum liners containing waste were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN2922 was punctured by a nail in a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel overpacked the damaged 5-gallon container in one (1) 35-gallon drum. The crew utilized hand tools to containerize all UN2922-impacted debris in the previously mentioned 35-gallon drum.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 88-pound drum of UN1325 arrived damaged due to shipping errors and released approximately eight (8) ounces of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel patched the damaged drum and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum. The crew utilized a HEPA filter drum vacuum and absorbent pads to further remediate the affected area. All UN1325-impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120057
item.description:
Report E-2023120057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T00:35:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 experienced a stress fracture and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the damaged tote, patched the impacted area, and prepared for the gravity transfer. The crew labeled the new tote with the original labels and staged the drum onsite for handling by R+L personnel. The crew utilized absorbents to collect the released material. All waste was contained in one (1) 35-gallon drum.
